name: Acquisition of security or financial asset or interest therein
text:
(a)  A person acquires a security or an interest therein, under this article, if:



	(1)	The person is a purchaser to whom a security is delivered pursuant to section 490:8-301; or
	(2)	The person acquires a security entitlement to the security pursuant to section 490:8-501.



	(b)  A person acquires a financial asset, other than a security, or an interest therein, under this article, if the person acquires a security entitlement to the financial asset.
	(c)  A person who acquires a security entitlement to a security or other financial asset has the rights specified in part 5, but is a purchaser of any security, security entitlement, or other financial asset held by the securities intermediary only to the extent provided in section 490:8-503.
	(d)  Unless the context shows that a different meaning is intended, a person who is required by other law, regulation, rule, or agreement to transfer, deliver, present, surrender, exchange, or otherwise put in the possession of another person a security or financial asset satisfies that requirement by causing the other person to acquire an interest in the security or financial asset pursuant to subsection (a) or (b). [L 1997, c 33, pt of §2]
